newsitem.title: EGYPT: EGYPT TO OFFER GDRS IN TWO CHEMICAL FIRMS BY JAN.
newsitem.headline: EGYPT TO OFFER GDRS IN TWO CHEMICAL FIRMS BY JAN.

text.p: The Egyptian state is planning to sell off shares in two chemical companies via global depository receipt (GDR) offerings in January, top privatisation official Atef Obeid was quoted on Tuesday as saying.

In October, the state sold a stake in Suez Cement through a GDR offering. Obeid, who is public enterprise minister, told the government-owned Al-Ahram newspaper that the state would now sell off stakes in Pachin/Paints and Chemical Industries and Misr Chemical Industries.
He did not specify how much of the partly privatised companies would be sold through the GDR.
"Successful GDRs encourage foreigners to invest in local companies and are international recognition for the company and the economy as a whole," Obeid said.
The offerings are part of Egypt's privatisation programme, itself a part of widescale economic reforms.
Egypt's first GDR offering was from the private sector Commerical Bank of Egypt. Shares are currently listed on the London Stock Exchange.
